info.name: 211 Nexus Documentation
info.description:
This collection is used to **document** the most current version of the API. The API may change. Please only update examples IF the Nexus API or other associated APIs change.

This collection is a fork of the official documentation hosted at: [Nexus211 API.](https://api.nexus211.com/docs/#/)

You can find element types for various data models in the [Element Type Documentation](https://app.hex.tech/5da8c0c4-952b-48c4-8d99-d85de0986b86/app/0195dd64-51b6-7004-8a88-e8013f776496/latest).

item.name: Search

request.description:
### API Request Description

This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve resource search results based on the provided ElasticSearch query parameters.

This route only searches for resources. The query can be in the [query string query](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/query-dsl-query-string-query.html) format or [match query](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/query-dsl-match-query.html).

#### Response Body

The response is a JSON object with the following structure:

- "__meta": Object containing metadata information such as total, perPage, currentLength, prevUrl, and nextUrl.
    
- "data": An array of objects containing detailed information about the search results, including id, createdAt, updatedAt, description, geoArea, status, visibility, limitedAvailability, alias, metadata, organization, site, service, networks, siteId, serviceId, references, hour, emails, phones, contactPersons, addresses, area, and _score.

request.description: ### API Request Description This API endpoint makes an HTTP POST request to retrieve resource search results based on the provided ElasticSearch query parameters in the body of your request. This route only searches for resources. The query can be in the [query string query](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/query-dsl-query-string-query.html) format or [match query](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/query-dsl-match-query.html). #### Request Body ``` json { "search": { "query": "your ElasticSearchQuery" } } ``` #### Response Body The response is a JSON object with the following structure: - "__meta": Object containing metadata information such as total, perPage, currentLength, prevUrl, and nextUrl. - "data": An array of objects containing detailed information about the search results, including id, createdAt, updatedAt, description, geoArea, status, visibility, limitedAvailability, alias, metadata, organization, site, service, networks, siteId, serviceId, references, hour, emails, phones, contactPersons, addresses, area, and _score.

request.description:
### Get Organization by Email

This endpoint retrieves organization details based on the provided email address.

UWGC Note: It doesn't seem particularly useful as you can search by organization in the GET /organization endpoint.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `/search/organization`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - email (string, required): The email address of the organization to search for.
        

#### Response

The response will contain an array of objects, with each object representing an organization. Each organization object includes the following properties:

- id (string): The unique identifier of the organization.
    
- createdAt (string): The timestamp when the organization was created.
    
- updatedAt (string): The timestamp when the organization was last updated.
    
- name (string): The name of the organization.
    
- description (string): A brief description of the organization.
    
- state (string): The state where the organization is located.
    
- city (string): The city where the organization is located.
    
- country (string): The country where the organization is located.
    
- timezone (string): The timezone of the organization.
    
- website (string): The website URL of the organization.
    
- logo (string): The URL of the organization's logo.
    
- email (string): The email address of the organization.
    
- address (string): The address of the organization.
    
- zipcode (string): The zipcode of the organization.
    
- createdById (string): The unique identifier of the user who created the organization.
    
- demographicSurveyId (string): The unique identifier of the demographic survey associated with the organization.

response.name: Organization Search Example

[

        "id": "HxQd8a4AQS2vnNXJCn7LPA8t1bDOLr",

item.description:
The search API is leveraged by the UWGC 211 website. It's receives elastic search queries and returns large scale search results at scale and with greater speed than other GET APIs. The UWGC website leverages the POST Resource Search Endpoint.

The Resource Search API **only contains ACTIVE resources** as defined by the Agency -> Resource hierarchy.

item.name: Agency

request.description:
### GET /agency

This endpoint retrieves agency information along with associated sites and services.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://api.nexus211.com/agency`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - $with (optional): Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response (e.g. sites, services).
        

#### Response

The response will include an array of agency objects with the following properties:

- id (string)
    
- createdAt (string)
    
- updatedAt (string)
    
- name (string)
    
- description (string)
    
- url (string, nullable)
    
- directorName (string)
    
- directorTitle (string)
    
- yearIncorporated (integer)
    
- annualBudget (integer)
    
- irsTaxCode (string)
    
- federalEIN (string)
    
- status (string)
    
- surveyType (string)
    
- legalStatus (string)
    
- isArchived (boolean)
    
- alias (array of strings)
    
- metadata (object):
    
    - adminDescription (string)
        
    - inactiveReason (string)
        
- agencyType (string, nullable)
    
- organizationId (string)
    

Additionally, the response includes metadata with the following properties:

- __meta:
    
    - total (integer)
        
    - perPage (integer)
        
    - currentLength (integer)
        
    - prevUrl (string, nullable)
        
    - nextUrl (string, nullable)

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific agency identified by the provided ID.

### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://api.nexus211.com/agency/:id`
    

### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

The response contains various details about the agency, including its name, description, director's information, year of incorporation, annual budget, tax-related information, status, survey type, legal status, and more.

The response also includes information about the parent agency, organization details, services offered by the agency, associated sites, funding sources, annotations, contact details such as addresses, emails, and phone numbers, as well as references and hours of operation.

The response provides connections between different elements such as the agency's organization, services, sites, addresses, emails, phones, contact persons, references, and hours, allowing consumers to understand the comprehensive details of the agency without providing a complete JSON example.

request.description:
### Create Agency

This API endpoint allows you to create a new agency with the provided details.

#### Request Body

- `name` (string): The name of the agency.
    
- `description` (string): A brief description of the agency.
    
- `url` (string): The URL of the agency's website.
    
- `directorName` (string): The name of the director of the agency.
    
- `directorTitle` (string): The title of the director.
    
- `yearIncorporated` (integer): The year the agency was incorporated.
    
- `annualBudget` (integer): The annual budget of the agency.
    
- `irsTaxCode` (string): The IRS tax code of the agency.
    
- `federalEIN` (string): The federal Employer Identification Number of the agency.
    
- `status` (string): The status of the agency.
    
- `surveyType` (string): The type of survey conducted by the agency.
    
- `legalStatus` (string): The legal status of the agency.
    
- `isArchived` (boolean): Indicates if the agency is archived.
    
- `alias` (array of strings): An array of alias names for the agency.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata for the agency.
    
    - Contains `inactiveReason`and `adminDescription`
        
- `organization` (string): The ID of the organization associated with the agency.
    
- `childId` (string): The ID of the child agency, if applicable.
    
- `parentId` (string): The ID of the parent agency, if applicable.
    

#### Response

The response JSON is just the full object that you created.

response.name: Create Agency Example

These are the good guys.

request.description:
### Patch Agency

This endpoint is used to update agency details by providing the agency ID in the URL. The request should include a JSON payload with the updated agency information such as name, description, URL, director details, financial information, status, survey type, legal status, and metadata.

**Request Body:**

- `name`(string): The name of the agency.
    
- `description`(string): A brief description of the agency.
    
- `url`(string): The URL of the agency's website.
    
- `directorName`(string): The name of the agency director.
    
- `directorTitle`(string): The title of the agency director.
    
- `yearIncorporated`(number): The year the agency was incorporated.
    
- `annualBudget`(number): The annual budget of the agency.
    
- `irsTaxCode`(string): The IRS tax code of the agency.
    
- `federalEIN`(string): The federal EIN of the agency.
    
- `status`(string): The status of the agency.
    
- `surveyType`(string): The type of survey conducted by the agency.
    
- `legalStatus`(string): The legal status of the agency.
    
- `isArchived`(boolean): Indicates if the agency is archived.
    
- `alias`(array of strings): Alias or alternative names for the agency.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional administrative metadata for the agency.
    
    - Contains `inactiveReason` (string) and `adminDescription` (string)
        
- `organization` (string): The ID of the organization associated with the agency.
    
- `childId` (string): The ID of the child agency.
    
- `parentId` (string): The ID of the parent agency.
    

**Response:**  
The response will contain the updated agency details, including the ID, timestamps, name, description, URL, director details, financial information, status, survey type, legal status, archive status, alias, metadata, and organization details.

item.description:
Agencies are the highest in the agency > service > site > resource hierarchy. They respresent the legal entities that provide services; they can have an address, phone, and email.

Agencies are developed in [Dashboard | CS Resource](https://resource.211cs.org/) and utilized by CS Care and CS Contact for referrals.

item.name: Agency Group

request.description:
# Get Agency Group

This endpoint retrieves a list of agency groups.

## Request

### Endpoint

`GET https://api.nexus211.com/agency-group`

## Response

The response will contain an array of objects, each representing an agency group. Each object will have the following properties:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier for the agency group.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of when the agency group was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp of when the agency group was last updated.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the agency group.
    
- `description` (string): The description of the agency group.
    
- `alias` (string, optional): An alias for the agency group, if available.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The unique identifier of the organization to which the agency group belongs.
    

In addition, the response will also include metadata in the `__meta` object, providing information about the total number of agency groups, pagination details, and URLs for the previous and next pages.

response.name: GET Agency Groups by ID

request.description:
# Get Agency Group Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific agency group based on the provided ID.

## Request

### Path Parameters

- `id` (string, required): The ID of the agency group.
    

## Response

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the agency group.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The date and time when the agency group was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The date and time when the agency group was last updated.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the agency group.
    
- `description` (string): A brief description of the agency group.
    
- `alias` (array of strings): An array of aliases associated with the agency group.
    
- `agencies` (array): An array of agencies belonging to the agency group, each containing detailed information such as ID, name, description, and more.
    
- `organization` (object): Details of the organization to which the agency group belongs, including ID, name, description, country, and more.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The ID of the organization to which the agency group belongs.

response.name: Agency Group

request.description:
### Create New Agency Group

This endpoint allows you to create a new agency group.

#### Request Body

- `name` (string, required): The name of the agency group.
    
- `description` (string, required): A description of the agency group.
    
- `alias` (array of strings, optional): An array of aliases for the agency group.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "name": "The Galaxy",
  "description": "A group that encompasses Star...",
  "alias": ["GAL"]
}

 ```

#### Response

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the created agency group.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the agency group was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the agency group was last updated.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the agency group.
    
- `description` (string): The description of the agency group.
    
- `alias` (array of strings): An array of aliases for the agency group.
    
- `agencies` (array): An array of agencies associated with the group.
    
- `organization` (object): Details of the organization associated with the group.
    - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the organization.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the organization was created.
        
    - `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the organization was last updated.
        
    - `name` (string): The name of the organization.
        
    - `description` (string): The description of the organization.
        
    - `state` (string): The state of the organization.
        
    - `city` (string): The city of the organization.
        
    - `country` (string): The country of the organization.
        
    - `timezone` (string): The timezone of the organization.
        
    - `website` (string): The website of the organization.
        
    - `logo` (string): The logo of the organization.
        
    - `email` (string): The email of the organization.
        
    - `address` (string): The address of the organization.
        
    - `zipcode` (string): The zipcode of the organization.
        
    - `createdById` (string): The unique identifier of the user who created the organization.
        
    - `demographicSurveyId` (string): The unique identifier of the demographic survey associated with the organization.
        
- `organizationId` (string): The unique identifier of the organization associated with the group.

- name (string): The name of the agency group.
    
- description (string): A brief description of the agency group.
    
- alias (array of strings): An array of aliases for the agency group.
    

### Response

The response will be a revised version of the agency group.

request.description:
### Add Agency to Agency Group

This endpoint allows the addition of a new agency to a specific agency group.

#### Request Body

- `agency` (string): The unique identifier of the agency to be added to the group.
    

#### Response

The response will include the status of the operation (OK) or any error messages.

response.name: Add Agency to Group Example
response.body: Created

request.description:
### Delete Agency from Agency Group

This endpoint is used to delete a specific agency from an agency group.

#### Request Body

- No request body is required for this DELETE request.
    

#### Response

- The response will not contain a body, but will include a status code to indicate the success or failure of the deletion operation.

response.name: Remove Agency from Group Example
response.body: OK

item.description: Agency Groups are a grouping mechanism for agencies. There is a many to many connection between agencies and agency groups with an implicit join table leveraged by the API that connects agency to agency groups. This appears in the GET /agency-group/:id route in the agencies JSON field.

item.name: Site

request.description:
# Get Site Information

This endpoint retrieves information about sites which are the physical locations of agencies.

## Response

The response will contain an array of site objects, each with the following properties:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the site.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of when the site was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp of when the site was last updated.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the site.
    
- `url` (string, optional): The URL of the site.
    
- `description` (string): A description of the site.
    
- `status` (string): The status of the site.
    
- `alias` (array of strings): An array of aliases for the site.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata about the site, including the `replicatesAgency` boolean value.
    
- `agency` (object): Information about the agency associated with the site, including the `status` property.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The identifier of the organization associated with the site.
    
- `agencyId` (string): The identifier of the agency associated with the site.
    

In addition, the response includes a `__meta` object with metadata about the total number of results and pagination information.

response.name: Get Sites by ID Example

request.description:
### Retrieve Site Information

This endpoint is used to retrieve information about a specific site identified by its ID.

#### Response

The response will be in the form of a JSON schema and will include details about the site, such as its ID, creation and update timestamps, name, URL, description, status, alias, metadata, agency details, organization details, resources, site groups, and contact information.

request.description:
### Create a New Site

This endpoint allows you to create a new site with the provided details.

#### Request Body

- `name` (string): The name of the site.
    
- `url` (string): The URL of the site.
    
- `agency` (string): The ID of the agency associated with the site.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata for the site.
    
- `organization` (string): The ID of the organization to which the site belongs.
    

#### Response

- `id` (string): The ID of the created site.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of when the site was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp of when the site was last updated.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the site.
    
- `url` (string): The URL of the site.
    
- `description` (string): The description of the site.
    
- `status` (string): The status of the site.
    
- `alias` (string): An alias for the site.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata for the site.
    
- `agency` (object): Details of the associated agency.
    
- `organization` (object): Details of the associated organization.
    
- `resources` (array): Any associated resources for the site.
    
- `siteGroups` (array): Any associated site groups for the site.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The ID of the organization to which the site belongs.
    
- `agencyId` (string): The ID of the agency associated with the site.
    
- `annotations` (array): Any annotations for the site.
    
- `addresses` (array): Addresses associated with the site.
    
- `emails` (array): Email addresses associated with the site.
    
- `phones` (array): Phone numbers associated with the site.
    
- `contactPersons` (array): Contact persons associated with the site.
    
- `references` (array): References associated with the site.
    
- `hour` (object): Details of the operating hours for the site.

item.description:
Sites are the second lowest in the agency > service > site > resource hierarchy. They represent places that agencys operate in; they can have an address, phone, and email.

Sites are developed in [Dashboard | CS Resource](https://resource.211cs.org/) and utilized by CS Care and CS Contact for referrals.

item.name: Site Group

request.description:
### GET /site-group

This endpoint retrieves a list of site groups. This is **not in use** by the UWGC resource team.

response.name: GET Site Groups Example

request.description:
# Get Site Group Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific site group identified by the provided `id`.

## Request

### Parameters

- `id` (string, required): The unique identifier of the site group.

## Response

Upon a successful request, the endpoint returns the details of the site group in the following format:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the site group.
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating the creation date of the site group.
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp indicating the last update date of the site group.
- `name` (string): The name of the site group.
- `description` (string): The description of the site group.
- `alias` (array of strings): An array of aliases associated with the site group.
- `organization` (object): Details of the organization to which the site group belongs, including its `id`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `name`, `description`, `state`, `city`, `country`, `timezone`, `website`, `logo`, `email`, `address`, `zipcode`, `createdById`, and `demographicSurveyId`.
- `sites` (array): An array of sites associated with the site group.
- `organizationId` (string): The unique identifier of the organization to which the site group belongs.

request.description:
### Create Site Group

This endpoint allows you to create a new site group.

#### Request Body
- name (string, required): The name of the site group.
- description (string, required): A brief description of the site group.
- alias (array of strings, optional): An array of aliases for the site group.

Example:
```json
{
  "name": "The Dark Side Group",
  "description": "A group that encompasses Star...",
  "alias": ["DARK"]
}
```

#### Response
The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- id (string): The unique identifier of the site group.
- createdAt (string): The timestamp when the site group was created.
- updatedAt (string): The timestamp when the site group was last updated.
- name (string): The name of the site group.
- description (string): A brief description of the site group.
- alias (array of strings): An array of aliases for the site group.
- organization (object): Information about the organization to which the site group belongs, including its id, name, description, state, city, country, timezone, website, logo, email, address, zipcode, createdById, and demographicSurveyId.
- sites (array): An array of sites associated with the site group.
- organizationId (string): The unique identifier of the organization to which the site group belongs.

Example:

request.description:
### Update Site Group

This endpoint allows the client to update a specific site group identified by the provided ID.

#### Request Body
- The request should include a JSON payload with the following parameters:
  - `name` (string): The updated name of the site group.
  - `description` (string): The updated description of the site group.
  - `alias` (array of strings): An array of aliases for the site group.

Example:
```json
{
  "name": "The Dark Side Sites",
  "description": "A group that encompasses Star...",
  "alias": ["DARK"]
}
```

#### Response
The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

```json
{
  "id": "",
  "createdAt": "",
  "updatedAt": "",
  "name": "",
  "description": "",
```

request.description:
This API endpoint allows you to add a new site to a specific site group identified by the provided ID. The request should be sent as an HTTP POST to the specified URL with the site group ID in the URL path and the site details in the request body.

### Request Body

- site (string, required): The unique identifier of the site to be added to the site group.
    

### Response

The response of this request is either a 200 OK or an error.

response.name: Add Site to Group Example

request.description:
This endpoint is used to delete a specific site within a site group. The site group is identified by the provided ID, and the site to be deleted is specified as a query parameter. 

### Request Body
This request does not require a request body.

### Response Body
Upon a successful deletion, the response will not include a response body. If the deletion is unsuccessful, an error message will be provided in the response body.

response.name: Remove Site from Group Example
response.body: OK

item.description: Site Groups are a grouping mechanism for agencies. There is a many to many connection between sites and site groups with an implicit join table leveraged by the API that connects site to site groups. This appears in the GET /site-group/:id route in the sites JSON field.

request.description:
## Get Service Details

This endpoint retrieves details of a specific service identified by the provided ID.

### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://api.nexus211.com/service/:id`
    

### Response

The response will include the following details about the service:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the service.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the service was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the service was last updated.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the service.
    
- `description` (string): A brief description of the service.
    
- `status` (string): The status of the service.
    
- `geoArea` (object): Details about the geographical area covered by the service.
    
- `airsTaxonomyId` (string): The taxonomy ID associated with the service.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata including taxonomy information.
    
- `agency` (object): Details about the agency responsible for the service.
    
- `organization` (object): Details about the organization associated with the service.
    
- `resources` (array): List of resources available for the service.
    
- `serviceGroups` (array): List of service groups associated with the service.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The ID of the organization associated with the service.
    
- `agencyId` (string): The ID of the agency responsible for the service.
    
- Other miscellaneous details such as addresses, emails, phones, contact persons, and references.
    

**Note:** The actual response may contain more specific information within each key.

request.description:
### Create Service
This endpoint allows the creation of a new service within the Nexus211 platform.

#### Request Body
- `name` (string): The name of the service.
- `geoArea` (string): The geographical area covered by the service.
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata related to the service.
- `organization` (string): The ID of the organization associated with the service.
- `airsTaxonomyId` (string): The taxonomy ID for the service.

#### Response
- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the created service.
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the service was created.
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the service was last updated.
- `name` (string): The name of the service.
- `description` (string): Description of the service.
- `status` (string): The status of the service.
- `geoArea` (string): The geographical area covered by the service.
- `airsTaxonomyId` (string): The taxonomy ID for the service.
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata related to the service.
- `agency` (object): Details of the agency associated with the service.
- `organization` (object): Details of the organization associated with the service.
- `resources` (array): List of resources related to the service.
- `serviceGroups` (array): List of service groups associated with the service.
- `organizationId` (string): The ID of the organization associated with the service.
- `agencyId` (string): The ID of the agency associated with the service.
- `annotations` (array): List of annotations related to the service.
- `addresses` (array): List of addresses associated with the service.
- `emails` (array): List of emails associated with the service.
- `phones` (array): List of phone numbers associated with the service.
- `contactPersons` (array): List of contact persons associated with the service.
- `references` (array): List of references related to the service.
- `hour` (object): Details of the service hours.

This endpoint allows the user to update the details of a specific service.

#### Request Body

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the service.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the service was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the service was last updated.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the service.
    
- `description` (string): The description of the service.
    
- `status` (string): The status of the service.
    
- `geoArea` (null): The geographical area covered by the service.
    
- `airsTaxonomyId` (null): The taxonomy ID associated with the service.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata related to the service.
    - `airsTaxonomy` (object): Taxonomy information.
        - `targetTerms` (array): Array of target terms.
            - `code` (string): The code of the target term.
                
            - `name` (string): The name of the target term.
                
        - `taxonomyTerm` (object): Taxonomy term details.
            - `code` (string): The code of the taxonomy term.
                
            - `name` (string): The name of the taxonomy term.
                
- `organizationId` (string): The unique identifier of the organization associated with the service.
    
- `agencyId` (string): The unique identifier of the agency associated with the service.
    
- `annotations` (array): Array of annotations associated with the service.
    
- `addresses` (array): Array of addresses associated with the service.
    
- `emails` (array): Array of emails associated with the service.
    
- `phones` (array): Array of phone numbers associated with the service.
    
- `contactPersons` (array): Array of contact persons associated with the service.
    
- `references` (array): Array of references associated with the service.
    
- `hour` (null): The operational hours of the service.
    

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object with the updated details of the service, including the `id`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `name`, `description`, `status`, `geoArea`, `airsTaxonomyId`, `metadata`, `agency`, `organization`, `resources`, `serviceGroups`, `organizationId`, `agencyId`, `annotations`, `addresses`, `emails`, `phones`, `contactPersons`, `references`, and `hour`.

response.name: Edit Service Example

item.description:
Service are the second highest in the agency > service > site > resource hierarchy. They represent a service that can be offered at multiple sites. For example, a food pantry could have more than one location but is only connected to a single agency.

Services are developed in [Dashboard | CS Resource](https://resource.211cs.org/) and utilized by CS Care and CS Contact for referrals.

item.name: Service Group

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of service groups from the Nexus API.

### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

### Response

The response will include an array of service groups, with each object containing the following properties:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier for the service group.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the service group was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the service group was last updated.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the service group.
    
- `description` (string): A description of the service group.
    
- `alias` (string): An alias for the service group, if available.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The unique identifier for the organization to which the service group belongs.
    

In addition, the response will also include metadata in the `__meta` object, which provides details about the total number of service groups, pagination information, and URLs for the previous and next pages of results.

response.name: GET Service Groups Example

request.description:
### Get Service Group Details
This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific service group based on the provided ID.

#### Request
- Method: GET
- URL: `{{nexus_api_url}}/service-group/:id`

#### Response
The response will include the details of the service group, including its ID, creation and update timestamps, name, description, alias, and organization information. Additionally, it will provide an array of services within the group, each containing their respective ID, timestamps, name, description, status, and metadata. The organization details for each service, including their ID, creation and update timestamps, name, description, state, city, country, timezone, website, logo, email, address, zipcode, created by ID, and demographic survey ID will also be included.

response.name: Service Group Example

request.description:
### Create Service Group

This endpoint allows you to create a new service group.

#### Request Body

- name (string, required): The name of the service group.
    
- description (string, required): A brief description of the service group.
    
- alias (array of strings, required): An array of aliases for the service group.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "name": "The Dark Side Group",
  "description": "A group that encompasses Star...",
  "alias": ["DARK"]
}

 ```

#### Response

The response will be the created Service Group with its connected organization object.

### Create Service in Service Group

This endpoint allows the user to add a new service to a specific service group.

#### Request

- Method: POST
    
- URL: `https://api.nexus211.com/service-group/:id/service`
    
- Body:
    
    - `service` (string, required): The unique identifier for the new service.

request.description:
This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to delete a specific service within a service group, identified by the provided ID. The request includes a query parameter to specify the service to be deleted.

### Response

The response of this request is a JSON schema representing the structure of the response data that will be returned upon successful deletion of the service.

response.body: OK

item.description: Service Groups are a grouping mechanism for services. There is a many to many connection between services and service groups with an implicit join table leveraged by the API that connects site to service groups. This appears in the GET /service-group/:id route in the services JSON field.

item.name: Resource

request.description:
### Retrieve Resource Information

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve resource information from the Nexus211 API.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

The response will include an array of resource objects, each containing the following fields:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the resource.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the resource was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the resource was last updated.
    
- `description` (string): A brief description of the resource.
    
- `geoArea` (object): The geographical area associated with the resource.
    
- `status` (string): The status of the resource.
    
- `visibility` (string): The visibility status of the resource.
    
- `limitedAvailability` (boolean): Indicates if the resource has limited availability.
    
- `alias` (string): An alias for the resource.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata including fees, documents, eligibility, service area name, region, conditions, exclusions, zip codes, requirements, and application procedure.
    
- `site` (object): Information about the site associated with the resource, including status and agency details.
    
- `service` (object): Information about the service associated with the resource, including status.
    
- `siteId` (string): The unique identifier of the site associated with the resource.
    
- `serviceId` (string): The unique identifier of the service associated with the resource.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The unique identifier of the organization associated with the resource.
    

The '__meta' object provides additional metadata about the response, including the total number of resources, pagination details, and URLs for the previous and next pages.

response.name: GET by ID Example

request.description:
# Retrieve Resource by ID

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a specific resource by its ID.

## Request

### Path Parameters

- `id` (string, required): The ID of the resource to retrieve.
    

## Response

The response of this request is a JSON object representing a specific resource. Connected data structures include:

Top level Emails, Phones, and Addresses are "attached" to the resource and should take priority over all other options.

- Site
    
- Addresses
    
- Emails
    
- Phones
    
- Contact Person(s)
    
- References
    
- Hours
    
- Services
    
- Organization

request.description:
## Resource Creation

This endpoint is used to create a new resource with the specified details.

### Request Body

- `site` (string): The identifier for the site.
    
- `service` (string): The identifier for the service.
    
- `limitedAvailability` (boolean): Indicates if the resource has limited availability.
    
- `visibility` (string): The visibility of the resource.
    
- `alias` (array of strings): An array of aliases for the resource.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata for the resource.
    
- `geoArea` (object): Geographic area information for the resource.
    
- `description` (string): Description of the resource.
    
- `organization` (string): The identifier for the organization - this is optional and will default to the organization you're currently logged in as.
    

### Response

Returns all submitted properties plus a new `id`, `createdAt`, updatedAt, and a full object for `agency`, `service`, `site`, and `organization`.

request.description:
## Resource Creation

This endpoint is used to create a new resource with the specified details.

### Request Body

- `site` (string): The identifier for the site.
    
- `service` (string): The identifier for the service.
    
- `limitedAvailability` (boolean): Indicates if the resource has limited availability.
    
- `visibility` (string): The visibility of the resource.
    
- `alias` (array of strings): An array of aliases for the resource.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata for the resource.
    
- `geoArea` (object): Geographic area information for the resource.
    
- `description` (string): Description of the resource.
    
- `organization` (string): The identifier for the organization.
    

### Response

Returns all updated submitted properties plus connected data for `agency`, `service`, `site`, and `organization`.

item.description:
Resources are the lowest level in the agency > service > site > resource hierarchy. Resources are developed in [Dashboard | CS Resource](https://resource.211cs.org/) and utilized by CS Care and CS Contact for referrals.

"Attached Phones" appear in the parent Resource phones array in `GET /resources/:id`.

item.name: Referral

request.description:
### GET /referral

This endpoint retrieves referral data.

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object with the following schema:

- `id` (string): id of the referral.
    
- `resourceId` (string): ID for the connected resource for the referral
    
- `transactionId` (string): ID for the connected transaction.
    
- `organizationId` (string): ID for the organization that the user was logged into when creating the referral.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the profile was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the profile was last updated.

request.description:
# Get Referral Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a referral based on the provided ID.

## Request

### Parameters

- `id` (string, required): The unique identifier of the referral.
    

## Response

Upon a successful request, the API returns a JSON object with the following properties:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the referral.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the referral was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the referral was last updated.
    
- `resource` (object): Details of the resource related to the referral, including its ID, creation and update timestamps, description, status, visibility, availability, metadata, site ID, service ID, and organization ID.
    
- `transaction` (object): Information about the transaction associated with the referral, such as its ID, creation and update timestamps, start and close timestamps, metadata, organization ID, network ID, and subject ID.
    
- `resourceId` (string): The ID of the resource associated with the referral.
    
- `transactionId` (string): The ID of the transaction associated with the referral.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The ID of the organization associated with the referral.
    

In case of an error or if the referral ID is not found, an appropriate error response will be returned.

response.name: Referral Example

request.description:
This API endpoint allows you to create a new referral. The request should have a JSON request body containing the following parameters:

- `resource`: (string) The resource identifier for the referral. This is the resource ID.
    
- `transaction`: (string) The transaction identifier for the referral. This is the transaction ID.
    

Upon a successful request, the API will respond with the created referral object, including the following fields:

- `resource`: The resource identifier for the referral.
    
- `transaction`: The transaction identifier for the referral.
    
- `organization`: The organization associated with the referral.
    
- `deletedAt`: The timestamp when the referral was deleted, if applicable.
    
- `id`: The unique identifier for the referral.
    
- `createdAt`: The timestamp of the referral creation.
    
- `updatedAt`: The timestamp of the referral's last update.

response.name: Create Referral

request.description:
### Delete Referral

This endpoint is used to delete a specific referral by its ID.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body and uses the ID in the params to delete the referral.

#### Response

The response will not contain a response body. The status code will indicate the success or failure of the deletion operation.

item.description: A referral is a way to connect a person in need with a resource in their community. In data terms, this means connecting a transaction and a resource. Transactions connected to resources will then refer back to both the referrer and the referree using the subjectId and the agentId on the transaction event objects that are linked to that transaction.

item.name: Profile

request.description:
### Get Profiles with Survey

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a profiles, and you can include a specific survey.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://api.nexus211.com/profile`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - `$withSurvey` (string, required): Identifier for the survey to be included in the response.
        

#### Response

The `data` array contains the profile information, including `id`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `email`, `unconfirmedEmail`, `roles`, `metadata`, `userId`, `organizationId`, and `createdUsingId`.

response.name: GET Profiles example

request.description:
# Profile Information Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves profile information for a specific user identified by the provided ID.

## Request

### Request URL

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://api.nexus211.com/profile/:id`
    

### Path Parameters

- `id` (string, required): The unique identifier of the user's profile.
    

## Response

Upon a successful request, the server returns a JSON object with the following fields:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the profile.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating the creation date of the profile.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp indicating the last update date of the profile.
    
- `email` (string): The email address associated with the profile.
    
- `unconfirmedEmail` (string): The unconfirmed email address associated with the profile.
    
- `roles` (array): An array of roles assigned to the user.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata associated with the profile.
    
- `organization` (object): Information about the user's organization.
    
    - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the organization.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating the creation date of the organization.
        
    - `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp indicating the last update date of the organization.
        
    - `name` (string): The name of the organization.
        
    - `description` (string): The description of the organization.
        
    - `state` (string): The state of the organization.
        
    - `city` (string): The city of the organization.
        
    - `country` (string): The country of the organization.
        
    - `timezone` (string): The timezone of the organization.
        
    - `website` (string): The website of the organization.
        
    - `logo` (string): The logo of the organization.
        
    - `email` (string): The email address of the organization.
        
    - `address` (string): The address of the organization.
        
    - `zipcode` (string): The zipcode of the organization.
        
    - `createdById` (string): The unique identifier of the creator of the organization.
        
    - `demographicSurveyId` (string): The unique identifier of the demographic survey associated with the organization.
        
- `user` (object): Information about the user.
    
    - `firstName` (string): The first name of the user.
        
    - `lastName` (string): The last name of the user.
        
    - `email` (string): The email address of the user.
        
- `userId` (string): The unique identifier of the user.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The unique identifier of the organization associated with the profile.
    
- `createdUsingId` (string): The unique identifier of the method used to create the profile.

request.description:
### Profile Creation

This endpoint allows you to create a new profile with the specified role and organization.

**Request Body**

- `role` (string): The role of the member.
    
- `organization` (string): The ID of the organization.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata for the profile.
    

**Response**  
The response will include the newly created profile with the following fields:

- `id` (string): The ID of the profile.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the profile was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the profile was last updated.
    
- `email` (string): The email associated with the profile.
    
- `unconfirmedEmail` (string): The unconfirmed email associated with the profile.
    
- `roles` (array of strings): The roles assigned to the profile.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata for the profile.
    
- `organization` (object): Details of the organization associated with the profile, including ID, name, description, state, city, country, timezone, website, logo, email, address, zipcode, createdById, and demographicSurveyId.
    
- `user` (object): Details of the user associated with the profile.
    
- `userId` (string): The ID of the user associated with the profile.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The ID of the organization associated with the profile.
    
- `createdUsingId` (string): The ID of the entity used to create the profile.

request.description:
### Update Profile Email

This endpoint allows the user to update the unconfirmed email associated with the user's profile.

#### Request Body

- `unconfirmedEmail` (string, required): The new unconfirmed email address to be associated with the user's profile.
    
- `email` (string, not allowed): You cannot change this property.
    

#### Response

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the profile.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of the profile creation.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp of the profile update.
    
- `email` (string): The confirmed email address associated with the profile.
    
- `unconfirmedEmail` (string): The new unconfirmed email address associated with the profile.
    
- `roles` (array): The roles assigned to the user.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata associated with the profile.
    
- `organization` (object): Details of the organization associated with the profile.
    
- `user` (object): Details of the user associated with the profile.
    
- `userId` (string): The unique identifier of the user.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The unique identifier of the organization.
    
- `createdUsingId` (string): The unique identifier of the creator.

request.description:
This route does is the correct documentation for PATCH /profile/:id/share.

### POST /profile/:profile_id/share

This endpoint is used to share a specific profile with a network.

#### Request Body

- `profile` (string): The ID of the profile to be shared.
    
- `network` (string): The network with which the profile will be shared.
    

#### Response

- `id` (string): The ID of the shared profile.

response.name: Add Profile to Network Example

request.description:
### POST /profile/:profile_id/unshare

This endpoint is used to "unshare" a specific profile from a network.

#### Request Body

- `profile` (string): The ID of the profile to be unshared.
    
- `network` (string): The network with which the profile will be shared.
    

#### Response

- `id` (string): The ID of the unshared profile.

response.name: Unshare Profile From Network

item.description:
Profiles act as a way to store information about both members (people that work for an organization) and contacts (profiles created by folks on the phone).

Profiles connect to cases as some profile and survey data is available via that API.

item.name: Network

request.description:
### Get Network

This endpoint retrieves network information.

#### Request

There are no request parameters for this endpoint.

#### Response

The response is an object with an array of JSON data in the `data` property. The `__meta` object contains pagination information, and the `data` array includes network details such as `id`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `name`, `description`, and `createdById`.

response.name: GET Networks by ID Example

request.description:
### Retrieve Network Information

This endpoint is used to retrieve information about a specific network identified by its ID.

#### Response

The response will be in the form of a JSON schema and will include details about the site, such as its ID, creation and update timestamps, name, createdBy (which is the organization), organizations (which are organizations that are connected to it.

request.description:
### Update Network Details

This endpoint allows you to update the details of a specific network.

#### Request Body

- `name` (string): The updated name of the network.
    
- `description` (string): The updated description of the network.
    

#### Response

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the network.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of when the network was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp of when the network was last updated.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the network.
    
- `description` (string): The description of the network.
    
- `createdBy` (object): Details of the user who created the network.
    
- `organizations` (array): List of organizations associated with the network.
    
- `createdById` (string): The unique identifier of the user who created the network.

item.description: Networks are defined by CareSuite as: "A group of organizations that collaborate on one or more projects." Therefore, networks are two things: 1) a grouping mechanism for organizations and 2) a grouping mechanism for projects.

item.name: Organization

request.description:
### Get Organization Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of organizations.

**Request Body:**  
This is a GET request and does not require a request body.

**Response:**  
The response will contain an array of organization objects, including their unique IDs, creation and update timestamps, names, descriptions, locations, website URLs, logos, email addresses, addresses, zip codes, created by IDs, and demographic survey IDs. The "__meta" object provides metadata about the total number of organizations, items per page, current length, and pagination URLs.

item.description:
Organizations are one of the main tools to navigate CS apps. Once logged in, you'll need to select an organization to continue interacting with data. This service account is connected to the UAT account provided by Nexus.

Organization governs your ability to see and manage data.

item.name: Phone

request.description:
### GET /phone

This endpoint retrieves phone data.

#### Request

This is a GET request to the endpoint GET `/phone`.

#### Response

The response for this request can be represented as a

response.name: GET Phones by ID Example
GET Phones Example

request.description:
### GET /phone/:id

This endpoint retrieves phone details based on the provided ID.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

- `id` (path parameter) - The ID of the phone.
    

#### Response

The response will include the following properties:

- `id` - The unique identifier of the phone.
    
- `createdAt` - The timestamp indicating when the phone record was created.
    
- `updatedAt` - The timestamp indicating when the phone record was last updated.
    
- `elementType` - The type of element associated with the phone.
    
- `elementId` - The ID of the associated element.
    
- `description` - The description of the phone, if available.
    
- `number` - The phone number.
    
- `extension` - The extension of the phone number.
    
- `types` - An array of types associated with the phone.
    
- `functions` - An array of functions associated with the phone.
    
- `isConfidential` - Indicates whether the phone details are confidential.
    
- `metadata` - Additional metadata including sort order.
    
- `organization` - Details of the organization associated with the phone.
    
    - `id` - The ID of the organization.
        
    - `createdAt` - The timestamp indicating when the organization record was created.
        
    - `updatedAt` - The timestamp indicating when the organization record was last updated.
        
    - `name` - The name of the organization.
        
    - `description` - The description of the organization.
        
    - `state` - The state of the organization.
        
    - `city` - The city of the organization.
        
    - `country` - The country of the organization.
        
    - `timezone` - The timezone of the organization.
        
    - `website` - The website of the organization.
        
    - `logo` - The logo of the organization.
        
    - `email` - The email of the organization.
        
    - `address` - The address of the organization.
        
    - `zipcode` - The zipcode of the organization.
        
    - `createdById` - The ID of the user who created the organization record.
        
    - `demographicSurveyId` - The ID of the associated demographic survey.
        
- `organizationId` - The ID of the organization associated with the phone.
    

This endpoint retrieves phone details based on the provided ID.

item.description:
Phone is a data structure that collects phone data and connects it to Contact Person, Site, and Agency.

Find more on element types for phones in the [Element Type Documentation](https://app.hex.tech/5da8c0c4-952b-48c4-8d99-d85de0986b86/app/0195dd64-51b6-7004-8a88-e8013f776496/latest).

Note: once you've assigned a phone an element type and ID, you cannot change it.

item.description:
Address is a data structure that collects address data and connects it to Site and Agency.

Quick notes because the structure of addresses is a little odd:

- region = state
    
- locality = city
    

Find more on element types for addresses in the [Element Type Documentation](https://app.hex.tech/5da8c0c4-952b-48c4-8d99-d85de0986b86/app/0195dd64-51b6-7004-8a88-e8013f776496/latest).

Note: once you've assigned an address an element type and ID, you cannot change it.

item.name: Email

request.description:
# Retrieve Email Information

This endpoint allows you to retrieve email information.

## Request

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

### Request URL

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://api.nexus211.com/email`
    

## Response

The response will contain an array of email information objects.

### Response Body

The response body will include the following fields for each email information object:

- `id` (string)
    
- `createdAt` (string)
    
- `updatedAt` (string)
    
- `emailAddress` (string)
    
- `description` (string or null)
    
- `isConfidential` (boolean)
    
- `metadata` (object)
    
    - `sortOrder` (null or string)
        
- `elementType` (string)
    
- `elementId` (string)
    
- `organizationId` (string)
    

In addition, the response will also include metadata in the `__meta` object:

- `total` (number)
    
- `perPage` (number)
    
- `currentLength` (number)
    
- `prevUrl` (string or null)
    
- `nextUrl` (string or null)

request.description:
### Create Survey Endpoint

This endpoint allows you to create a new survey.

#### Request Body

- `name` (string, required): The name of the survey.
    
- `entity` (string, required): The entity associated with the survey.
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `organization` (object): Details of the organization associated with the survey.
    
    - plus connected org properties
        
- `entityName` (string): The name of the entity associated with the survey.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the survey.
    
- `deletedAt` (string): The timestamp when the survey was deleted, if applicable.
    
- `id` (string): The ID of the survey.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the survey was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the survey was last updated.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The ID of the organization associated with the survey.

response.name: Survey Response Data Example

request.description:
### Create Survey Session

This endpoint allows the creation of a survey session for a specific survey.

#### Request Body

- `subject` (text): The ID of the subject for the survey session.
    
- `redirectUrl` (text): The URL to redirect the subject to after completing the survey session.
    
- `transaction` (text): The transaction identifier for the survey session.
    
- `agent` (text): The identifier of the agent associated with the survey session.
    

#### Response

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the created survey session.
    
- `url` (string): The URL of the survey session.
    
- `expiresAt` (string): The expiration timestamp of the survey session.

response.name: Create Survey Session Instance Example

item.description:
Surveys can have two types that are defined in the entityType property. Here are teh two types:

- profile (which oft-referred to as the demographic survey)
    
- Transaction
    

There is only one profile survey per organization and it is created/edited only by organization admins. Transaction surveys are any other survey that an organization leverages.

Other than specifying the entity type and the name of a survey, surveys functionally serve as a way to connect survey responses and survey forms.

Survey Response Example

item.name: Survey Form

body.raw:
{
    "xml": "<?xml version="1.0"?>
<h:html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2002/xforms" xmlns:ev="http://www.w3.org/2001/xml-events" xmlns:h="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:jr="http://openrosa.org/javarosa" xmlns:odk="http://www.opendatakit.org/xforms" xmlns:orx="http://openrosa.org/xforms" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <h:head>
    <h:title>Test: Intake Survey</h:title>
    <model odk:xforms-version="1.0.0">
      <instance>
        <aW6pdQR6xjepKYJ7NTt7XK id="aW6pdQR6xjepKYJ7NTt7XK">
          <start/>
          <end/>
          <Primary_need/>
          <Notes/>
          <meta>
            <instanceID/>
          </meta>
        </aW6pdQR6xjepKYJ7NTt7XK>
      </instance>
      <bind jr:preload="timestamp" jr:preloadParams="start" nodeset="/aW6pdQR6xjepKYJ7NTt7XK/start" type="dateTime"/>
      <bind jr:preload="timestamp" jr:preloadParams="end" nodeset="/aW6pdQR6xjepKYJ7NTt7XK/end" type="dateTime"/>
      <bind nodeset="/aW6pdQR6xjepKYJ7NTt7XK/Primary_need" required="false()" type="string"/>
      <bind nodeset="/aW6pdQR6xjepKYJ7NTt7XK/Notes" required="false()" type="string"/>
      <bind jr:preload="uid" nodeset="/aW6pdQR6xjepKYJ7NTt7XK/meta/instanceID" readonly="true()" type="string"/>
    </model>
  </h:head>
  <h:body>
    <select1 ref="/aW6pdQR6xjepKYJ7NTt7XK/Primary_need">
      <label>Primary need:</label>
      <item>
        <label>Financial assistance</label>
        <value>financial_assistance</value>
      </item>
      <item>
        <label>Employment</label>
        <value>employment</value>
      </item>
      <item>
        <label>Education</label>
        <value>education</value>
      </item>
      <item>
        <label>Food</label>
        <value>food</value>
      </item>
    </select1>
    <input appearance="multiline" ref="/aW6pdQR6xjepKYJ7NTt7XK/Notes">
      <label>Notes:</label>
    </input>
  </h:body>
</h:html>
"
}

item.description: Survey Forms are the data structure translation of the XML forms that are submitted when creating a new survey. So surveys themselves don't really contain any real data, rather they are a connection table between survey forms and survey responses.

item.name: Transaction

request.description:
### Retrieve Transaction Details

This endpoint allows you to retrieve transaction details.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://api.nexus211.com/transaction`
    

#### Response

The response will include the following fields:

- `__meta`: An object containing metadata about the response, including total number of transactions, items per page, current length, previous and next URLs.
    
- `data`: An array of transaction objects, each containing the following fields:
    
    - `id`: The unique identifier of the transaction.
        
    - `createdAt`: The timestamp when the transaction was created.
        
    - `updatedAt`: The timestamp when the transaction was last updated.
        
    - `startedAt`: The timestamp when the transaction was started.
        
    - `closedAt`: The timestamp when the transaction was closed, if available.
        
    - `metadata`: Additional metadata about the transaction, including notes, contact information, and IVR data.
        
    - `organizationId`: The identifier of the organization associated with the transaction.
        
    - `networkId`: The identifier of the network associated with the transaction, if available.
        
    - `subjectId`: The identifier of the (profile for the) subject associated with the transaction.

response.name: GET Transactions by ID

request.description:
# Get Transaction Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific transaction identified by the provided transaction ID.

## Request

### Parameters

- `id` (path) : The unique identifier of the transaction.
    

## Response

- `id` : The unique identifier of the transaction.
    
- `createdAt` : The timestamp when the transaction was created.
    
- `updatedAt` : The timestamp when the transaction was last updated.
    
- `startedAt` : The timestamp when the transaction started.
    
- `closedAt` : The timestamp when the transaction was closed, or null if it is still open.
    
- `metadata` : Additional metadata including notes, contact information, and IVR data.
    
- `events` : An array of events associated with the transaction, including action, element type, element ID, and other details.
    
- `organization` : Details of the organization involved in the transaction, including ID, name, description, location, website, and more.
    
- `subject` : Details of the subject involved in the transaction, including ID, email, roles, and organization ID.
    
- `organizationId` : The ID of the organization involved in the transaction.
    
- `networkId` : The ID of the network associated with the transaction.
    
- `subjectId` : The ID of the subject involved in the transaction.

item.description:
Transactions are an grouping structure for events in a series that keep track of the interactions that a subject (person that calls into a 211) has with agents. Transactions are directly related to transaction events profiles via the agent and subject properties.

Agent is not actually housed in the transaction object, though. Instead, it is attached to the transaction events that the agent creates. This is because multiple agents could work on one transaction, and so any one agent does not "own" any one transaction.

item.name: Transaction Event

request.description:
This endpoint is a firehose of everything happens attached to transactions.

- Note: you cannot filter by agentId

Create Transaction Event Example

item.description:
Transaction Events are actions taken on a CareSuite application by a user that connects various data structures together. The idea is that everything on CareSuite will be event driven. Transaction events are also immutable and cannot be changed once created.

Transaction Event Actions are [available here](https://app.hex.tech/5da8c0c4-952b-48c4-8d99-d85de0986b86/app/0195ed78-8e2f-7002-ba05-e2a5dfc0debc/latest).

You can find element types for transaction events in the [Element Type Documentation](https://app.hex.tech/5da8c0c4-952b-48c4-8d99-d85de0986b86/app/0195dd64-51b6-7004-8a88-e8013f776496/latest).

item.name: Reference

request.description:
# API Request: Get Reference Data

This endpoint retrieves reference data from the Nexus211 API. References are URLs that are connected to sites, services, and resources. They're the only resource specific data connection you can make.

## Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://api.nexus211.com/reference`
    

## Response

The response will include an array of resource objects, each containing the following fields:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the resource.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the resource was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp indicating when the resource was last updated.
    
- `type` (string): Typically "url", but describes the type of reference.
    
- `label` (string): The label to use for the reference when appearing online.
    
- `uri` (string): The url string for the reference.
    
- `description` (string): A description for the reference URL.
    
- `isConfidential` (boolean): Indicates if the reference should be hidden.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata typically including only sortOrder.
    
- `elementType` (string): Either site, agency, or resource.
    
- `elementId` (string): ID of the connected element. Foreign key to an implicit join table.
    
- `organizationId` (string): The unique identifier of the organization associated with the resource.
    

The '__meta' object provides additional metadata about the response, including the total number of resources, pagination details, and URLs for the previous and next pages.

request.description:
## Resource Editing

This endpoint is used to create a new resource with the specified details.

### Request Body

- `limitedAvailability` (boolean): Indicates if the resource has limited availability.
    
- `visibility` (string): The visibility of the resource.
    
- `alias` (array of strings): An array of aliases for the resource.
    
- `metadata` (object): Additional metadata for the resource.
    
- `geoArea` (object): Geographic area information for the resource.
    
- `description` (string): Description of the resource.
    
- `organization` (string): The identifier for the organization.
    

### Response

- \`id\` (string): The identifier of the created resource.
    
- \`createdAt\` (string): The timestamp when the resource was created.
    
- \`updatedAt\` (string): The timestamp when the resource was last updated.
    
- \`description\` (string): The description of the resource.
    
- \`geoArea\` (object): Geographic area information for the resource.
    
- \`status\` (string): The status of the resource.
    
- \`visibility\` (string): The visibility of the resource.
    
- \`limitedAvailability\` (boolean): Indicates if the resource has limited availability.
    
- \`alias\` (array of strings): An array of aliases for the resource.
    
- \`metadata\` (object): Additional metadata for the resource.
    
- \`site\` (object): Information about the site where the resource is located.
    
- \`service\` (object): Information about the service related to the resource.
    
- \`organization\` (object): Information about the organization related to the resource.

item.name: Changelog

request.description:
The `GET` request to `/change-log` retrieves the change log data. The response is a JSON object with two main properties: `__meta` and `data`. The `__meta` property provides metadata about the response, including the total number of items and pagination details.

The `data` property contains an array of change log entries, with each entry including details such as `id`, `action`, `entityName`, `entityId`, `metadata`, `tags`, `createdAt`, `applicationId`, and `organizationId`.

You can search by action type, entity name, entity ID, profile id of the agent that made the change and createdAt time.

response.name: Changelog Example

item.description: The change log API provides a way to query all changes to essentially any entity that exists in CS. There's only a single GET endpoint that contains all changes across main data types.
